A: I'm not sure what you mean by "I'm using JAX-RS to create a web (rest) service that returns results in JSON format.Everything is OK, except the encoding. For example, I get: ..., parameter:"Dep\u00f3sitos" ,...Instead of: ..., parameter:"Depósitos" ,..."
But I think you are using the wrong method.
The method String.getBytes() returns the bytes of the string.
The method String.getBytes(String charsetName) returns the bytes of the string using the named charset.
The method String.getBytes(Charset charset) returns the bytes of the string using the specified charset.
The method String.getBytes(CharsetEncoder encoder) returns the bytes of the string using the specified encoder.
The method String.getBytes(CharsetDecoder decoder) returns the bytes of the string using the specified decoder.
